Hi all, I'm having a small search bar issue. I created two <input> classes for responsiveness (hiding/displaying at different viewports). What JS changes do I need to make to the search-input and/or search results modules so that the search bar works no matter which version is being displayed?
HTML:
```<input type="text" class="hs-search-field__input__large" id="search-bar-large" name="term[]" autocomplete="off" aria-label="{{ module.field_label || "Search" }}" placeholder="Search Blog Posts...">
<input type="text" class="hs-search-field__input__small" name="term[]" autocomplete="off" aria-label="{{ module.field_label || "Search" }}" placeholder="">```
JS (this only makes the "small" version work
``` var searchTerm = '',
    searchForm = _instance,
    searchField = _instance.querySelector('.hs-search-field__input__small'),
    searchResults = _instance.querySelector('.hs-search-field__suggestions'),```
I tried changing the searchField declaration to:
```searchField = _instance.querySelectorALL('.hs-search-field__input__small, .hs-search-field__input__large'),```
but that made neither size work.

TIA for any help!
